column4: Hello again, how could I install two Apache-php-mysql version into the same pc ?
How could I install two Apache-php-mysql version into the same pc ?
just put them in different places
How do I do that ?
with package managers you usually cant, but most hosting enviroments like to source compile all their stuff and then you get to choose where it goes
Source compiling is long and makes problem (depencies)
not long if your a hosting server, and its pretty trivial to install a few dependancies and in turn get better security and control over your business :)
And what about if I need very accurate apache version ?
then download and compile the source for it, wheres the problem?
why?
Cause it's the "stable" version that I currently use.
then wheres your problem? :S
youll have to src compile one way or the other, use a package manager and itll screw it up
Where do I find the 2.0.55 apache src ?
the apache site? itll surely have archives
seems they have 2.0.63, isnt that close enough?
http://archive.apache.org/dist/httpd/httpd-2.0.55.tar.bz2
Ok, the two version are compiling... I have to do the same with php I guess ? But the, how can I say to apache to use a php version or an other ?

use --prefix= in the configure line and do something like, put apache in /usr/local/apache with its php in /usr/local/apache/php and put the others in /usr/local/apache2 and /usr/local/apache2/php, then they dont go near eachother
Ok, for the prefix, it's what I've done. I'll try that with php.
aslong as you dont mix their configs and libs, youll be fine, tested method
I don't have a php directory on the apache directory... Should I create it ?
php will create it if its not there when you specify --prefix= for it
